5#ifndef V8_EXECUTION_FUTEX_EMULATION_H_
6#define V8_EXECUTION_FUTEX_EMULATION_H_

8#include <stdint.h>
9
10#include "include/v8-persistent-handle.h"
11#include "src/base/atomicops.h"
12#include "src/base/macros.h"
13#include "src/base/platform/condition-variable.h"

17
18// Support for emulating futexes, a low-level synchronization primitive. They
19// are natively supported by Linux, but must be emulated for other platforms.
20// This library emulates them on all platforms using mutexes and condition
21// variables for consistency.
22//
23// This is used by the Futex API defined in the SharedArrayBuffer draft spec,
24// found here: https://github.com/tc39/ecmascript_sharedmem
25
26namespace v8 {
27
28class Promise;
29
30namespace base {
31class TimeDelta;
32} // namespace base
33
34namespace internal {
35
36class BackingStore;
37class FutexWaitList;
38
39class Isolate;
40class JSArrayBuffer;
41
42class AtomicsWaitWakeHandle {
43 public:
44 explicit AtomicsWaitWakeHandle(Isolate* isolate) : isolate_(isolate) {}
45
46 void Wake();
47 inline bool has_stopped() const { return stopped_; }
48
49 private:
50 Isolate* isolate_;
51 bool stopped_ = false;
52};
53
54class FutexWaitListNode {
55 public:
56 // Create a sync FutexWaitListNode.
57 FutexWaitListNode() = default;
58
59 // Create an async FutexWaitListNode.
60 FutexWaitListNode(std::weak_ptr<BackingStore> backing_store,
61 void* wait_location, Handle<JSObject> promise_capability,
62 Isolate* isolate);
63
64 // Disallow copying nodes.
65 FutexWaitListNode(const FutexWaitListNode&) = delete;
66 FutexWaitListNode& operator=(const FutexWaitListNode&) = delete;
67
68 void NotifyWake();
69
70 bool IsAsync() const { return async_state_ != nullptr; }
71
72 // Returns false if the cancelling failed, true otherwise.
73 bool CancelTimeoutTask();
74
75 private:
76 friend class FutexEmulation;
77 friend class FutexWaitList;
78
79 // Async wait requires substantially more information than synchronous wait.
80 // Hence store that additional information in a heap-allocated struct to make
81 // it more obvious that this will only be needed for the async case.
82 struct AsyncState {
83 AsyncState(Isolate* isolate, std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> task_runner,
84 std::weak_ptr<BackingStore> backing_store,
85 v8::Global<v8::Promise> promise,
86 v8::Global<v8::Context> native_context)
87 : isolate_for_async_waiters(isolate),
88 task_runner(std::move(task_runner)),
89 backing_store(std::move(backing_store)),
90 promise(std::move(promise)),
91 native_context(std::move(native_context)) {
92 DCHECK(this->promise.IsWeak());
93 DCHECK(this->native_context.IsWeak());
94 }
95
96 ~AsyncState() {
97 // Assert that the timeout task was cancelled.
98 DCHECK_EQ(CancelableTaskManager::kInvalidTaskId, timeout_task_id);
99 }
100
101 Isolate* const isolate_for_async_waiters;
102 std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> const task_runner;
103
104 // The backing store on which we are waiting might die in an async wait.
105 // We keep a weak_ptr to verify during a wake operation that the original
106 // backing store is still mapped to that address.
107 std::weak_ptr<BackingStore> const backing_store;
108
109 // Weak Global handle. Must not be synchronously resolved by a non-owner
110 // Isolate.
111 v8::Global<v8::Promise> const promise;
112
113 // Weak Global handle.
114 v8::Global<v8::Context> const native_context;
115
116 // If timeout_time_ is base::TimeTicks(), this async waiter doesn't have a
117 // timeout or has already been notified. Values other than base::TimeTicks()
118 // are used for async waiters with an active timeout.
119 base::TimeTicks timeout_time;
120
121 // The task ID of the timeout task.
122 CancelableTaskManager::Id timeout_task_id =
123 CancelableTaskManager::kInvalidTaskId;
124 };
125
126 base::ConditionVariable cond_;
127 // prev_ and next_ are protected by FutexEmulationGlobalState::mutex.
128 FutexWaitListNode* prev_ = nullptr;
129 FutexWaitListNode* next_ = nullptr;
130
131 // The memory location the FutexWaitListNode is waiting on. Equals
132 // backing_store_->buffer_start() + wait_addr at FutexWaitListNode creation
133 // time. This address is used find the node in the per-location list, or to
134 // remove it.
135 // Note that during an async wait the BackingStore might get deleted while
136 // this node is alive.
137 void* wait_location_ = nullptr;
138
139 // waiting_ and interrupted_ are protected by FutexEmulationGlobalState::mutex
140 // if this node is currently contained in FutexEmulationGlobalState::wait_list
141 // or an AtomicsWaitWakeHandle has access to it.
142 bool waiting_ = false;
143 bool interrupted_ = false;
144
145 // State used for an async wait; nullptr on sync waits.
146 const std::unique_ptr<AsyncState> async_state_;
147};
148
149class FutexEmulation : public AllStatic {
150 public:
151 enum WaitMode { kSync = 0, kAsync };
152 enum class CallType { kIsNotWasm = 0, kIsWasm };
153
154 // Pass to Wake() to wake all waiters.
155 static const uint32_t kWakeAll = UINT32_MAX;
156
157 // Check that array_buffer[addr] == value, and return "not-equal" if not. If
158 // they are equal, block execution on |isolate|'s thread until woken via
159 // |Wake|, or when the time given in |rel_timeout_ms| elapses. Note that
160 // |rel_timeout_ms| can be Infinity.
161 // If woken, return "ok", otherwise return "timed-out". The initial check and
162 // the decision to wait happen atomically.
163 static Tagged<Object> WaitJs32(Isolate* isolate, WaitMode mode,
164 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer,
165 size_t addr, int32_t value,
166 double rel_timeout_ms);
167
168 // An version of WaitJs32 for int64_t values.
169 static Tagged<Object> WaitJs64(Isolate* isolate, WaitMode mode,
170 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer,
171 size_t addr, int64_t value,
172 double rel_timeout_ms);
173
174 // Same as WaitJs above except it returns 0 (ok), 1 (not equal) and 2 (timed
175 // out) as expected by Wasm.
176 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static Tagged<Object> WaitWasm32(
177 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer, size_t addr,
178 int32_t value, int64_t rel_timeout_ns);
179
180 // Same as Wait32 above except it checks for an int64_t value in the
181 // array_buffer.
182 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static Tagged<Object> WaitWasm64(
183 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer, size_t addr,
184 int64_t value, int64_t rel_timeout_ns);
185
186 // Wake |num_waiters_to_wake| threads that are waiting on the given |addr|.
187 // |num_waiters_to_wake| can be kWakeAll, in which case all waiters are
188 // woken. The rest of the waiters will continue to wait. The return value is
189 // the number of woken waiters.
190 // Variant 1: Compute the wait address from the |array_buffer| and |addr|.
191 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static int Wake(Tagged<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer,
192 size_t addr, uint32_t num_waiters_to_wake);
193 // Variant 2: Pass raw |addr| (used for WebAssembly atomic.notify).
194 static int Wake(void* addr, uint32_t num_waiters_to_wake);
195
196 // Called before |isolate| dies. Removes async waiters owned by |isolate|.
197 static void IsolateDeinit(Isolate* isolate);
198
199 // Return the number of threads or async waiters waiting on |addr|. Should
200 // only be used for testing.
201 static int NumWaitersForTesting(Tagged<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer,
202 size_t addr);
203
204 // Return the number of async waiters (which belong to |isolate|) waiting.
205 // Should only be used for testing.
206 static int NumAsyncWaitersForTesting(Isolate* isolate);
207
208 // Return the number of async waiters which were waiting for |addr| and are
209 // now waiting for the Promises to be resolved. Should only be used for
210 // testing.
211 static int NumUnresolvedAsyncPromisesForTesting(
212 Tagged<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer, size_t addr);
213
214 private:
215 friend class FutexWaitListNode;
216 friend class AtomicsWaitWakeHandle;
217 friend class ResolveAsyncWaiterPromisesTask;
218 friend class AsyncWaiterTimeoutTask;
219
220 template <typename T>
221 static Tagged<Object> Wait(Isolate* isolate, WaitMode mode,
222 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer, size_t addr,
223 T value, double rel_timeout_ms);
224
225 template <typename T>
226 static Tagged<Object> Wait(Isolate* isolate, WaitMode mode,
227 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer, size_t addr,
228 T value, bool use_timeout, int64_t rel_timeout_ns,
229 CallType call_type = CallType::kIsNotWasm);
230
231 template <typename T>
232 static Tagged<Object> WaitSync(Isolate* isolate,
233 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer,
234 size_t addr, T value, bool use_timeout,
235 int64_t rel_timeout_ns, CallType call_type);
236
237 template <typename T>
238 static Tagged<Object> WaitAsync(Isolate* isolate,
239 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> array_buffer,
240 size_t addr, T value, bool use_timeout,
241 int64_t rel_timeout_ns, CallType call_type);
242
243 // Resolve the Promises of the async waiters which belong to |isolate|.
244 static void ResolveAsyncWaiterPromises(Isolate* isolate);
245
246 static void ResolveAsyncWaiterPromise(FutexWaitListNode* node);
247
248 static void HandleAsyncWaiterTimeout(FutexWaitListNode* node);
249
250 static void NotifyAsyncWaiter(FutexWaitListNode* node);
251
252 // Remove the node's Promise from the NativeContext's Promise set.
253 static void CleanupAsyncWaiterPromise(FutexWaitListNode* node);
254};
255} // namespace internal
256} // namespace v8
257
258#endif // V8_EXECUTION_FUTEX_EMULATION_H_
